NATO diplomats meeting in Budapest raised security concerns over what they say is a deepening relationship between Russia and Hungary.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_00
sentences.sentence: The European Parliament has awarded the Sakharov Prize to Masa Amini, the young Kurdish-Iranian who died last year after being arrested for allegedly violating Iran's mandatory headscarf law.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_00
sentences.sentence: The prize was also awarded to the social movement that was sparked by Amini's death, Women, Life, Freedom.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_00
sentences.sentence: The Sakharov Prize for Freedom and Conscience is the highest tribute paid by the EU in the field of human rights. The award recognizes the work and bravery of tens of thousands of Iranian women who took to the streets for months to protest Amini's death in defiance of the Iranian regime. The protests spread quickly throughout the country and only ended after a bloody repression that left more than 500 dead and some 22,000 detained.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_00
sentences.sentence: Last year's prize was awarded to the people of Ukraine for their resistance to Russia's invasion and defiance in the ongoing war.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_08
sentences.sentence: EU interior ministers discussed the lessons the bloc should learn after two terrorist attacks hit Europe in just one week.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_08
sentences.sentence: Shortly after the Hamas attacks in Israel, a teacher was killed in the French city of Arras.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_08
sentences.sentence: And on Monday, a suspected extremist shot two Swedish football fans dead in Brussels.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_08
sentences.sentence: The perpetrator, Abdesalam Lassoed, allegedly used loopholes in the European asylum system and managed to stay off the grid, despite being well-known to authorities.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_07
sentences.sentence: The guy who was then committing the crimes, the terror crimes in Belgium on Monday night. He was deported from Sweden in 2010 as a Dublin case.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_07
sentences.sentence: And since then he obviously has been able to show up in different countries in the Union.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_07
sentences.sentence: And so that also are the scores, I think, of the Dublin system, the border control, efficient return systems, sharing information between our member countries.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_08
sentences.sentence: MALCOLM BRABANT, Ministers also discussed the need to fight online radicalization, which played a role in both recent attacks. They pledged more cooperation, including information exchange between member states, and called for effective checks at external borders.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_09
sentences.sentence: We have done a lot. So already this year we've seen an increase with 20 percent of returnees.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_09
sentences.sentence: So we are actually effectively returning more people today. But still more needs to be done. And specifically for me, it's important that those individuals that could cause, could be a security threat to our citizens, to our union, has to be returned forcefully immediately.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_08
sentences.sentence: Due to the terrorist threat, Italy and Slovenia have announced they will introduce checks on their land borders.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_08
sentences.sentence: This adds to the numerous exemptions to the Schengen agreement in Europe.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_08
sentences.sentence: Despite this, the Spanish presidency of the Council of the EU says the bloc could give Romania and Bulgaria the green light to join the Schengen area in December.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_00
sentences.sentence: The European Commission is ramping up pressure on social media platforms to crack down on what it considers violent content, false information and hate speech.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_14
sentences.sentence: It's launched an investigation into Meta and TikTok, asking them to explain what they're doing to comply with new digital rules.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_14
sentences.sentence: It follows a spike in posts related to the Israel-Hamas war in breach of the EU Digital Services Act.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_14
sentences.sentence: The request is the first step in a procedure that could result in costly penalties if the platforms fail to comply.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_14
sentences.sentence: The new rules took effect in August.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_14
sentences.sentence: They require big tech companies to stop a wide range of illegal content from flourishing on their platforms.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_14
sentences.sentence: Brussels sent its first formal request to Elon Musk's social media site X last week.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_14
sentences.sentence: The billionaire is said to be considering removing the app's availability in the EU or blocking users from accessing it.
